title: 13 Best Ceramic Brands and Online Pottery Shops 2025
description: From East Fork's charming serveware to Etsy's vintage finds
author: Audrey Lee
excerpt: We found the best ceramic brands and online pottery shops to feed your desire for above-average decor accents. From Etsy, Amazon, 1stDibs, and more.
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.The best ceramic brands and online pottery shops offer wares that come in many forms: a beautiful vase filled with fresh flowers, a statement fruit bowl, and oversized planters to name a few. But our favorite innovative integrations lean more toward the unexpected. Think: Gwyneth Paltrow’s plate wall or the Sean Gerstley cocktail table from this California Canyon home. In our search for the best pottery and ceramics, we discovered textured terra-cotta pots, food-safe stoneware, and several colorfully glazed creations that will incorporate an artisanal feel to your decor. Our picks below include one-of-a-kind vintage pieces and Etsy gems that will fool guests into thinking you’re a professional designer.Our Top Picks for the Best Ceramic Brands and Online Pottery Shops:For Eclectic Wares: SSENSEFor Elegant Neutrals: ArhausFor All Budgets: AmazonFor Designer Collabs: Crate & BarrelFor Coastal Vibes: Serena & LilyFor Vintage: EtsySsenseSsense’s pool of talented potters and ceramicists includes the likes of Forma Rosa, Henry Holland, Louise Roe, and Vitra. While there’s a good mix of more mundane offerings, we think the colorful and kooky designs—like these vases with squiggly handles and washed pastel hues—are the main attraction. Plus, for the most diligent shoppers, items often come up at steep discounts during sale season.Harlie Brown Studio Marble Wiggle VaseLaetitia Rouget 'Listen to the Birds' VaseArhausArhaus isn’t just the place to splurge on a really nice sectional sofa. The brand’s selection of decor and accents is also a great place to source elegant tabletop ceramics. Much like the furniture, the color palettes here are diffused and feel like something you could have come across in a flea market—the Eva and Santorini vases are just a sampling of what else you can find from the retailer.Arhaus Santorini Low VaseArhaus Eva VaseAmazonAmazon has no shortage of ceramics in their stacked decor section, but the tricky part is sifting through everything to find hidden gems. Luckily for you, we spotted this fish-shaped vase from Ottolenghi for Serax that’s worth a splurge, and a very budget-friendly striped bud vase—a nice demonstration of the different price points you can find from the retailer.Bloomingville Stoneware Bowl with OrbsSerax Fish Flower VaseCrate & BarrelOne of our favorite sources for elevated design staples, Crate & Barrel’s designer collaborations make the retailer a particular standout among their peers. It’s no secret that we’re fans of Athena Calderone’s work , and this ceramic vase from her collection with the brand is an easy way to bring a small slice of the designer’s style into your own home.Divinus Vase by Athena CalderoneCrate & Barrel Clyborne Textured VaseSerena & LilyEven the pottery at Serena & Lily leans coastal—if you’re outfitting a Hamptons Home or Cape Cod cottage, look no further. The brand’s Spinnaker tray is one of the more unexpected items on this list, and we love the endless potential of this versatile piece. Use it to hold a vase full of fresh flowers and coasters on a coffee table or as a serving dish to bring out fresh lemonade while guests are enjoying a sunny day in the backyard.Serena & Lily Spinnaker TraySerena & Lily Morro Porcelain VaseEtsyEtsy is a treasure trove of one-of-a-kind vintage and handmade pottery from ceramic artists around the world. So much so that it’s easy to get overwhelmed by all the options. We recommend narrowing down your search with specific keywords of what you’re looking for—like “Italian vintage,” “Scandi,” or “midcentury modern”—which is how we were able to dig up these finds.Vintage Swung VaseIris Series Vase by Mari Simmulson for Upsala EkebyAnthropologieAnthropologie is a paradise for anyone looking to fill their shelves with pottery and ceramic accents. The lighting and kitchenware categories are particularly robust, though there are also plenty of trinket boxes, catchall trays, and more to fuel your desire for out-of-the-box wares.Vietri Campagna Serving BowlGaley Alix x Livabliss Camden Ford Table LampWayfairLike Amazon, sorting through all of Wayfair’s options can feel like an endless scroll. However, we like that the retailer’s ceramic and pottery selection features a lot of vase sets, like this peacock-esque patterned trio from Wade Logan. You can also find more expensive, one-of-one pieces in the mix, like this lunar-inspired vase with interesting texture.Jamie Young Company Table VaseWade Logan Ayriauna Vase (Set of 3)West ElmNo matter what your decor archetype may be, there’s a good chance you’ll be able to find what you’re looking for at West Elm, which caters to just about every design persona. In addition to their line of ceramics designed in-house, West Elm also features a selection of artisanal pottery from small artists and businesses through their West Elm Local program—like the Keraclay coil vase by Brooklyn-based artist Virginia Felix.Form Studies Face VaseKeraclay Coil Vase1stDibsFor rare vintage pieces, 1stDibs is the way to go. We especially like the idea of using the retailer as a shortcut to get the look of your favorite celebrity’s Open Door. There’s a curated array of Majolica wares (to emulate Dakota Johnson’s collection), as well as lots of interesting plating (perhaps to make your own decorative wall à la Gwyneth).Salins Majolica Oyster PlateRoyal Delft Blue PlatterDesign Within ReachDWR is an elite choice for furniture and home decor, so it’s no surprise that the retailer also stocks some of the best designs for pottery (just be prepared to pay up). Both handmade and easy-to-style, the Poltrona Frau and Sin Ceramics pieces we highlighted feel like heirlooms you’ll pass down to future generations.Poltrona Frau Ikiperu VaseSin Ceramics Doline VaseTory BurchWhile you might think of Tory Burch as the source for this year’s It sandals, we’re here to give the brand’s homeware their flowers (in a lettuce leaf vase, obviously). There’s a noticeably elevated French country theme running through the decorative vases, pitchers, teapots, and serving platters, making them a nice choice if you’re looking for pieces that match the cottagecore vibe you’ve been cultivating this spring.Tory Burch Oiseau PitcherTory Burch Lettuce Ware Candelstick (Set of 2)East ForkEast Fork, the brand known for turning pasta bowls into works of art, uses its pottery to uphold a high standard of craftsmanship and technique—every piece of pottery feels thoughtfully made. “I use my East Fork Small Mug every morning and it brings me so much joy,” says contributor Stewart Savin. “The gorgeous prune-colored ceramic has a wonderful feel to it while being extremely durable. As a North Carolinian with a yard full of red clay, it’s exciting to see our natural resources brought to life by Western NC artisans.” (Plus, the social-media-beloved items make perfect gifts.)East Fork Shallow Dinner SetEast Fork Terracotta Herb Pots (Set of 3)
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

The best ceramic brands and online pottery shops offer wares that come in many forms: a beautiful vase filled with fresh flowers, a statement fruit bowl, and oversized planters to name a few. But our favorite innovative integrations lean more toward the unexpected. Think: Gwyneth Paltrow’s plate wall or the Sean Gerstley cocktail table from this California Canyon home. In our search for the best pottery and ceramics, we discovered textured terra-cotta pots, food-safe stoneware, and several colorfully glazed creations that will incorporate an artisanal feel to your decor. Our picks below include one-of-a-kind vintage pieces and Etsy gems that will fool guests into thinking you’re a professional designer.

Our Top Picks for the Best Ceramic Brands and Online Pottery Shops:

  • For Eclectic Wares: SSENSE
  • For Elegant Neutrals: Arhaus
  • For All Budgets: Amazon
  • For Designer Collabs: Crate & Barrel
  • For Coastal Vibes: Serena & Lily
  • For Vintage: Etsy

Ssense

Ssense’s pool of talented potters and ceramicists includes the likes of Forma Rosa, Henry Holland, Louise Roe, and Vitra. While there’s a good mix of more mundane offerings, we think the colorful and kooky designs—like these vases with squiggly handles and washed pastel hues—are the main attraction. Plus, for the most diligent shoppers, items often come up at steep discounts during sale season.

Harlie Brown Studio Marble Wiggle Vase

Laetitia Rouget 'Listen to the Birds' Vase

Arhaus

Arhaus isn’t just the place to splurge on a really nice sectional sofa. The brand’s selection of decor and accents is also a great place to source elegant tabletop ceramics. Much like the furniture, the color palettes here are diffused and feel like something you could have come across in a flea market—the Eva and Santorini vases are just a sampling of what else you can find from the retailer.

Arhaus Santorini Low Vase

Arhaus Eva Vase

Amazon

Amazon has no shortage of ceramics in their stacked decor section, but the tricky part is sifting through everything to find hidden gems. Luckily for you, we spotted this fish-shaped vase from Ottolenghi for Serax that’s worth a splurge, and a very budget-friendly striped bud vase—a nice demonstration of the different price points you can find from the retailer.

Bloomingville Stoneware Bowl with Orbs

Serax Fish Flower Vase

Crate & Barrel

One of our favorite sources for elevated design staples, Crate & Barrel’s designer collaborations make the retailer a particular standout among their peers. It’s no secret that we’re fans of Athena Calderone’s work , and this ceramic vase from her collection with the brand is an easy way to bring a small slice of the designer’s style into your own home.

Divinus Vase by Athena Calderone

Crate & Barrel Clyborne Textured Vase

Serena & Lily

Even the pottery at Serena & Lily leans coastal—if you’re outfitting a Hamptons Home or Cape Cod cottage, look no further. The brand’s Spinnaker tray is one of the more unexpected items on this list, and we love the endless potential of this versatile piece. Use it to hold a vase full of fresh flowers and coasters on a coffee table or as a serving dish to bring out fresh lemonade while guests are enjoying a sunny day in the backyard.

Serena & Lily Spinnaker Tray

Serena & Lily Morro Porcelain Vase

Etsy

Etsy is a treasure trove of one-of-a-kind vintage and handmade pottery from ceramic artists around the world. So much so that it’s easy to get overwhelmed by all the options. We recommend narrowing down your search with specific keywords of what you’re looking for—like “Italian vintage,” “Scandi,” or “midcentury modern”—which is how we were able to dig up these finds.

Vintage Swung Vase

Iris Series Vase by Mari Simmulson for Upsala Ekeby

Anthropologie

Anthropologie is a paradise for anyone looking to fill their shelves with pottery and ceramic accents. The lighting and kitchenware categories are particularly robust, though there are also plenty of trinket boxes, catchall trays, and more to fuel your desire for out-of-the-box wares.

Vietri Campagna Serving Bowl

Galey Alix x Livabliss Camden Ford Table Lamp

Wayfair

Like Amazon, sorting through all of Wayfair’s options can feel like an endless scroll. However, we like that the retailer’s ceramic and pottery selection features a lot of vase sets, like this peacock-esque patterned trio from Wade Logan. You can also find more expensive, one-of-one pieces in the mix, like this lunar-inspired vase with interesting texture.

Jamie Young Company Table Vase

Wade Logan Ayriauna Vase (Set of 3)

West Elm

No matter what your decor archetype may be, there’s a good chance you’ll be able to find what you’re looking for at West Elm, which caters to just about every design persona. In addition to their line of ceramics designed in-house, West Elm also features a selection of artisanal pottery from small artists and businesses through their West Elm Local program—like the Keraclay coil vase by Brooklyn-based artist Virginia Felix.

Form Studies Face Vase

Keraclay Coil Vase

1stDibs

For rare vintage pieces, 1stDibs is the way to go. We especially like the idea of using the retailer as a shortcut to get the look of your favorite celebrity’s Open Door. There’s a curated array of Majolica wares (to emulate Dakota Johnson’s collection), as well as lots of interesting plating (perhaps to make your own decorative wall à la Gwyneth).

Salins Majolica Oyster Plate

Royal Delft Blue Platter

Design Within Reach

DWR is an elite choice for furniture and home decor, so it’s no surprise that the retailer also stocks some of the best designs for pottery (just be prepared to pay up). Both handmade and easy-to-style, the Poltrona Frau and Sin Ceramics pieces we highlighted feel like heirlooms you’ll pass down to future generations.

Poltrona Frau Ikiperu Vase

Sin Ceramics Doline Vase

Tory Burch

While you might think of Tory Burch as the source for this year’s It sandals, we’re here to give the brand’s homeware their flowers (in a lettuce leaf vase, obviously). There’s a noticeably elevated French country theme running through the decorative vases, pitchers, teapots, and serving platters, making them a nice choice if you’re looking for pieces that match the cottagecore vibe you’ve been cultivating this spring.

Tory Burch Oiseau Pitcher

Tory Burch Lettuce Ware Candelstick (Set of 2)

East Fork

East Fork, the brand known for turning pasta bowls into works of art, uses its pottery to uphold a high standard of craftsmanship and technique—every piece of pottery feels thoughtfully made. “I use my East Fork Small Mug every morning and it brings me so much joy,” says contributor Stewart Savin. “The gorgeous prune-colored ceramic has a wonderful feel to it while being extremely durable. As a North Carolinian with a yard full of red clay, it’s exciting to see our natural resources brought to life by Western NC artisans.” (Plus, the social-media-beloved items make perfect gifts.)

East Fork Shallow Dinner Set

East Fork Terracotta Herb Pots (Set of 3)
